intro: Saussurea candolleana var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The smooth saussurea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
